cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles S of Key West, Florida and 55 miles NE of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Initially moving west, forecast to turn WNW then NW into the eastern Gulf of Mexico before curving NE toward Florida’s Big Bend and then across GA/SC into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key–Apalachee Bay

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast from Tampa northward to the Big Bend, then inland across north-central Florida and the coasts of Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤11%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Thursday into Friday; gusty squalls possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side at this stage.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible mid-week as outer bands move over east-central Florida.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Occasional lightning in feeder bands; brief reduced visibility in heavy showers.
